red herring: If you say that something is a red herring, you mean that it is not important and it takes your attention away from the main subject or problem you are considering.
be associated with: If you associate someone or something with another thing, the two are connected in your mind.
make use of: If you make use of something, you do something with it in order to do a job or achieve a particular result of effect.
end up: If you end up doing something or end up in a particular state, you do that thing or get into that state even though you did not originally intend to.
grow out of: If something such as an idea or a plan grows out of something else, it develops from it.
dispense with: If you dispense with something, you stop using it or get rid of it completely, especially because you no longer need it.
